title: Inverse Trig Functions - inverse with arccos

content.question: ​The function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals 3 cos open parentheses pi x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less or equal than 1"><semantics><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following gives <math alttext="f to the power of negative 1 end exponent open parentheses x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="3 cos to the power of negative 1 end exponent open parentheses pi x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="negative 3 less or equal than x less or equal than 3"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="fraction numerator 1 over denominator 3 cos open parentheses pi x close parentheses end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="negative 3 less or equal than x less or equal than 3"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="pi cos to the power of negative 1 end exponent open parentheses x over 3 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>π</mi><msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="negative 3 less or equal than x less or equal than 3"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="1 over pi cos to the power of negative 1 end exponent open parentheses x over 3 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>π</mi></mfrac><msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="negative 3 less or equal than x less or equal than 3"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="1 over pi cos to the power of negative 1 end exponent open parentheses x over 3 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>π</mi></mfrac><msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="negative 3 less or equal than x less or equal than 3"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
